titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Thomas Pollard and William Wing, Indictment
CWG7384

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Caldwell Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky..
Against } November Term 1865.
Thomas Pollard and William Wing..

The Grand Jury of Caldwell County, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky: accuse Thomas Pollard and William Wing of the crime of Stealing a mule, committed as follows. viz: The said Thomas Pollard and William Wing on the 10" day of march 1864 in the county aforesaid willfully and feloniously took and carried away Brown Mare mule the personal property of Wiley Baker and of the value of One hundred dollars against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky,

John J McLin
Foreman Grand Jury
E P Campbell attorney for the Commonwealth

Information given by=
=Daniel Alsup
Wiley Baker
N M Nichols
Bench Warrant to Issue and bail fixed, at $200. each

R T Petree
A Copy
Att F W Dabney D C

Comlth
v } Indictment for Stealing a mule
Pollard & Wing
A true bill
John J McLin
Foreman Grand Jury
Filed & noted in open Court Decr 2nd 1865.
att F. W. Dabney C
A copy
fee 30,Â¢
